About Me...

I’m a rising senior at Yale University, where I’m studying economics. I care deeply about addressing economic inequality, so I’ve focused on studying tax policy, welfare, and community development. I have experience in direct service, academic research, and public policy. I’m always looking for opportunities to give my time and energy to causes helping low- and moderate-income families. Recently, I have started as an intern for{" "} Prosperity Now , where I’m working on the Policy Team to contribute to research on federal policies affecting low- and moderate-income families. In April, I was recognized as a member of the{" "} 2020 Class of Truman Scholars . I have also just finished a stint as a site coordinator for “Virtual VITA,” an alternative tax preparation service developed by me and my dear friend and VITA co-coordinator, Tylar Bloch. If you’re interested in getting in touch with me, please don’t hesitate to reach out! You can send me an{" "} email {" "} or connect with me on{" "} LinkedIn.

My Backstory

I am a proud Kansan and Child of Deaf Adults (CODA). I was raised by two Deaf parents, and my first language is American Sign Language. In my first year of high school, my father passed away from cancer. My mother is a first-generation Cuban-American, and I take great pride in being Cuban. My family, both immediate and extended, has faced a variety of economic hardships. From my grandmother traveling to America from Cuba to build a new life to my own mother working hard to make ends meet, I understand some of the consequences of economic instability. Now, I am a student at Yale University. I have my family, my friends, the Leadership Enterprise for a Diverse America, the Jack Kent Cooke Foundation, and the Truman Foundation to thank for my growth over time.

My Work

Prosperity Now (May - August 2020)
  • I worked with Prosperity Now’s policy team as a summer intern to provide research support on federal policies related to economic stability and the COVID-19 crisis. I published two blog posts on{" "} VITA {" "} and{" "} Congressional Stimulus Priorities , as well as wrote policy briefs about Prosperity Now’s 2021 policy goals and universal banking.
Yale Institute of Social and Policy Studies (January - December 2020)
  • I was selected as a{" "} Director's Fellow {" "} {" "} for the Institute. Through this program, I have received extensive training in public policy. I have collaboratively written a policy memo on potential VITA expansion in the Navajo Nation, and I am currently working on a longer whitepaper on the feasibility of universal banking in the United States.
Yale Law School Ludwig Center for Community & Economic Development {" "} (October 2019 - January 2020)
  • Under the supervision of Professor Anika Singh Lemar, I worked as a research assistant to the Community & Economic Development Clinic at Yale Law School. I researched New Haven and Connecticut food laws to help create presentations for food business entrepreneurs in the Collab New Haven Food Business Accelerator and for the{" "} Legal Food Hub of the Conservation Law Foundation.
Volunteer Income Tax Assistance Program (May 2019 - June 2020)
  • I served as the Co-President of{" "} one of the largest service organizations on Yale’s campus . I managed 150 volunteers across Yale University and coordinated free tax preparation for approximately 1,200 clients. In the 2020 tax season, we returned $1.3 million to taxpayers in the New Haven area. Upon the closure of Yale University due the pandemic, I worked with my Co-President Tylar Bloch to transition VITA to a totally virtual operation to continue serving clients.
Stacey Knoell for Kansas State Senate (July - November 2020)
  • I joined the{" "} Stacey Knoell Campaign {" "} as one of its first few Youth Fellows. In this role, I’ve helped the campaign with youth voter outreach efforts, phone banking, opposition research, and more.

Classes I've Taken

Books

  • The Yellow House Sarah M. Broom
  • Franchise Marcia Chatelain
  • Atomic Habits James Clear
  • Excellent Sheep William Deresiewicz
  • A House in the Sky Amanda Lindhout & Sara Corbett

Movies & TV Shows

  • Mrs. America
  • Westworld
  • Pulp Fiction
  • The Big Short
  • Gangs of New York

Nonprofits

  • Prosperity Now
  • Center on Budget and Policy Priorities
  • Institute on Taxation & Economic Policy
  • MicroGrants
  • Tax Policy Center
